title: Get Activities
description: Returns the list of activities available for the user.
name: get-activities

Success 200.description: Informative message to user, if no activities are assigned. NOTE: The message content changes based on the role of the user.
An array which contains the list of activities
A code which represents the type of the activity.

examples.title: Success-Response:

Header.description: Device OS version. Used during the time of removing app support for an OS Version.
The API key to identify the client.

examples.title: CommonHeader
examples.content:
{
    "App-Version": "0.0.1",
    "Build-Number": "0.0.1",
    "Device-Type": "Android",
    "Device-OS-Version": "10.0.3",
    "Device-Identifier": "34889-3248687-324876-324987-324876",
    "Api-Key": "AHuy1od49clkvj8ruv3pvp4m1lcg7lq6cmht"
}

title: Get Task
description: Returns the details of the requested task
name: get-task

examples.title: Params:

Success 200.description: The ETA of the task Format: MM dd YYYY, hh:mm a. Eg: Sept 29 2022, 12:00 PM
The expected hours to complete the task. Format: hh:mm Hrs
An array which contains the list of supply items and its current status
The current status of the supply item

examples.title: Success-Response:
examples.content:
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
{
     id: 58,
     name: "Fix internet connection",
     description: "",
     eta: "Oct 2 2022 12:00:00:AM",
     status: "Inactive",
     totalHours: "03:00 Hrs"
     status: "Start",
     supplies: [
         {
             name: "Hammer & Screw driver",
             status: "ONHAND",
             type: "Tools"
         }
     ]
 }

examples.title: AuthHeader

title: Punch In
description: Allow the user to punch-in to the system for marking the daily attendence.
name: punch-in

Success 200.description: Whether the user is punched in or punched out.
Total time the user worked. Note: This should be in seconds..

examples.title: Success-Response:
examples.content:
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
{
    token: "wr73shagas793w7983hasgcs63w74798478"
    id: "1998",
    name: "Robert William"
    department: "Store Keeper",
    attendencStatus: "PUNCHEDIN",
    workingTime: 564646,
    punchIn: "7:03 AM",
}

title: Punch Out
description: Allow the user to punch-out from the system for marking the daily attendence.
name: punch-out

Success 200.description: Total time the user worked. Note: This should be in seconds..
Total time between the first punch-in and last punch-out. Note: This should be in seconds..

examples.title: Success-Response:
examples.content:
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
{
    workingTime: 324243,
    grossTime: 347988,
    punchIn: "9:31 AM",
    punchOut: "5:31 PM"
}

title: Authenticate
description: Authenticate the user and return the necessary information about user.
name: authenticate

examples.title: Params:

Success 200.description: The full name of the user, concatinate if user's name stored as different components.
The name of the department the employee belongs to.
Whether the user is punched in or punched out.
Total time the user worked. Note: This should be in seconds..

examples.title: Success-Response:
examples.content:
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
{
     token:"jasghu643hfksjhkscrh4789873897958-"
     id: "1998",
     name: "Robert William"
     department: "Store Keeper",
     attendencStatus: "PUNCHEDIN",
     workingTime: 564646,
}

   id: "1998",
   name: "Robert William"
   roleId: 10,
   role: "Store Keeper",
   attendencStatus: "PUNCHEDIN",
   workingTime: 564646,
   punchIn: "7:03 AM",
   punchOut: "10:03 AM" 
}
